name: indicatively
content:
indicatively adverb
(AS A SIGN)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is a sign that something exists, is true, or is likely to happen: Indicatively, his 1985 autobiography is little more than a travel itinerary. Indicatively, he and his boyhood friends loved The Count of Monte Cristo.
More examplesFewer examplesThe pub is indicatively immaculate outside and spotlessly clean within.Indicatively, a market where the HHI exceeds approximately 1,800 may be considered highly concentrated.The judge's sentence was lower than those already set indicatively in the US.

language
  specialized in the mood (= form) of the verb used in ordinary statements and questions: All these verbs can be used indicatively as well.
